title: Basics
text: wdman (Webdriver Manager) R package allows user manage downloading/running third party binaries relating webdriver/selenium projects. package inspired similar node package webdriver-manager. checking/downloading binaries handled binman package running binaries processes handled processx package. wdman package currently manages following binaries: Selenium standalone binary chromedriver PhantomJS binary geckodriver iedriver Associated five functions download/manage binaries: selenium(...) chrome(...) phantomjs(...) gecko(...) iedriver(...) driver functions take number common arguments (verbose, check, retcommand) describe:

title: Basics
text: driver functions verbose argument controls message output user. verbose = TRUE messages relayed user inform drivers checked/downloaded/ran. default value driver functions TRUE. versus’s
code: selServ <- selenium(verbose = TRUE) ## checking Selenium Server versions:  ## BEGIN: PREDOWNLOAD  ## BEGIN: DOWNLOAD  ## BEGIN: POSTDOWNLOAD  ## checking chromedriver versions:  ## BEGIN: PREDOWNLOAD  ## BEGIN: DOWNLOAD  ## BEGIN: POSTDOWNLOAD  ## checking geckodriver versions:  ## BEGIN: PREDOWNLOAD  ## BEGIN: DOWNLOAD  ## BEGIN: POSTDOWNLOAD  ## checking phantomjs versions:  ## BEGIN: PREDOWNLOAD  ## BEGIN: DOWNLOAD  ## BEGIN: POSTDOWNLOAD  selServ$stop()  ## TRUE selServ <- selenium(verbose = FALSE) selServ$stop() ## TRUE

title: Basics
text: driver function check argument. check= TRUE function liaise driver repository updates. new driver versions available downloaded. binman package used purpose.

title: Basics
text: diagnostic purposes driver function retcommand argument. retcommand = TRUE command launched process instead returned string. example:
code: selCommand <- selenium(retcommand = TRUE, verbose = FALSE, check = FALSE) selCommand ## [1] "/usr/bin/java -Dwebdriver.chrome.driver='/Users/jkim/Library/Application Support/binman_chromedriver/mac64/80.0.3987.16/chromedriver' -Dwebdriver.gecko.driver='/Users/jkim/Library/Application Support/binman_geckodriver/macos/0.26.0/geckodriver' -Dphantomjs.binary.path='/Users/jkim/Library/Application Support/binman_phantomjs/macosx/2.1.1/phantomjs-2.1.1-macosx/bin/phantomjs' -jar '/Users/jkim/Library/Application Support/binman_seleniumserver/generic/4.0.0-alpha-2/selenium-server-standalone-4.0.0-alpha-2.jar' -port 4567" chromeCommand <- chrome(retcommand = TRUE, verbose = FALSE, check = FALSE) chromeCommand ## [1] "/Users/jkim/Library/Application Support/binman_chromedriver/mac64/80.0.3987.16/chromedriver --port=4567 --url-base=wd/hub --verbose"

title: Basics
text: selenium function manages Selenium Standalone binary. can check updates http://selenium-release.storage.googleapis.com/index.html run resulting binaries processes.

title: Basics
text: binary takes port argument defaults port = 4567L. number optional arguments use particular version binaries related browsers selenium may control. default selenium function look use latest version . selenium function returns list functions handle representing running process. returned output, error log functions give access stdout/stderr pipes cumulative stdout/stderr messages respectively. stop function sends signal terminates process:
code: selServ <- selenium(verbose = FALSE, check = FALSE) selServ$process ## PROCESS 'file50e6163b37b8.sh', running, pid 21289. selServ$log() ## $stderr ## [1] "13:25:51.744 INFO [GridLauncherV3.parse] - Selenium server version: 4.0.0-alpha-2, revision: f148142cf8"          ## [2] "13:25:52.174 INFO [GridLauncherV3.lambda$buildLaunchers$3] - Launching a standalone Selenium Server on port 4567" ## [3] "13:25:54.018 INFO [WebDriverServlet.<init>] - Initialising WebDriverServlet"                                      ## [4] "13:25:54.539 INFO [SeleniumServer.boot] - Selenium Server is up and running on port 4567"                          ## $stdout ## character(0) selServ$stop() ## TRUE

title: Basics
text: default selenium function includes paths chromedriver/geckodriver/ phantomjs Chrome/Firefox PhantomJS browsers available respectively. versions (chromever, geckover etc) given “latest”. user passes value NULL driver, excluded. Windows operating systems option included Internet Explorer driver also given. set iedrver = NULL ran default. Set iedrver = "latest" specific version string include Windows.

title: Basics
text: chrome function manages Chrome Driver binary. can check updates https://chromedriver.storage.googleapis.com/index.html run resulting binaries processes. chrome function runs Chrome Driver binary standalone process. takes default port argument port = 4567L. Users can connect directly chrome driver drive chrome browser. Similarly selenium function, chrome function returns list four functions handle underlying running process.
code: cDrv <- chrome(verbose = FALSE, check = FALSE) cDrv$process ## PROCESS 'file534c4e940dd8.sh', running, pid 21386. cDrv$log() ## $stderr ## character(0)  ## $stdout ## [1] "Starting ChromeDriver 80.0.3987.16 (320f6526c1632ad4f205ebce69b99a062ed78647-refs/branch-heads/3987@{#185}) on port 4567" ## [2] "Only local connections are allowed."                                                                                      ## [3] "Please protect ports used by ChromeDriver and related test frameworks to prevent access by malicious code." cDrv$stop() ## TRUE

title: Basics
text: phantomjs function manages PhantomJS binary. can check updates https://bitbucket.org/ariya/phantomjs/downloads run resulting binaries processes. phantomjs function runs PhantomJS binary standalone process webdriver mode. takes default port argument port = 4567L. Users can connect directly “ghostdriver” drive PhantomJS browser. Currently default version set version = "2.1.1". time writing 2.5.0-beta released. currently --date version ghostdriver associated . reason unstable/unpredictable use webdriver mode. Similarly selenium function, phantomjs function returns list four functions handle underlying running process.
code: pjsDrv <- phantomjs(verbose = FALSE, check = FALSE) pjsDrv$process ## PROCESS 'file5394b74d790.sh', running, pid 21443. pjsDrv$log() ## $stderr ## character(0)  ## $stdout ## [1] "[INFO  - 2020-01-31T21:32:04.538Z] GhostDriver - Main - running on port 4567" pjsDrv$stop() ## TRUE

title: Basics
text: gecko function manages Gecko Driver binary. can check updates https://github.com/mozilla/geckodriver/releases run resulting binaries processes. gecko function runs Gecko Driver binary standalone process. takes default port argument port = 4567L. Users can connect directly gecko driver drive firefox browser. Currently default version set version = "2.1.1". IMPORTANT point note geckodriver implements W3C webdriver protocol time writing finalised. Currently packages RSelenium implement JSONwireprotocol whilst similar expects different return underlying driver. geckodriver implementation like W3C webdriver specification incomplete point time. Similarly selenium function, gecko function returns list four functions handle underlying running process.
code: gDrv <- gecko(verbose = FALSE, check = FALSE) gDrv$process ## PROCESS 'file53946017eccb.sh', running, pid 21458. gDrv$log() ## $stderr ## character(0)  ## $stdout ## character(0) gDrv$stop()  ## TRUE

title: Basics
text: iedriver function manages Internet Explorer Driver binary. can check updates http://selenium-release.storage.googleapis.com/index.html run resulting binaries processes (iedriver distributed currently Selenium standalone binary amongst files). chrome function runs Chrome Driver binary standalone process. takes default port argument port = 4567L. Users can connect directly chrome driver drive chrome browser. Please note additional settings required drive Internet Explorer browser. Security settings zoom level need set correctly browser. author document needed set registry entry (ie 11). outlined https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/wiki/InternetExplorerDriver required configuration section. Similarly selenium function gecko function returns list four functions handle underlying running process.
code: ieDrv <- iedriver(verbose = FALSE, check = FALSE) ieDrv$process ## Process Handle ## command   : C:\Users\john\AppData\Local\binman\binman_iedriverserver\win64\3.0.0\IEDriverServer.exe /port=4567 /log-level=FATAL /log-file=C:\Users\john\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpqSdw94\file5247395f2a.txt ## system id : 7484 ## state     : running ieDrv$log() ## $stderr ## character(0) ##  ## $stdout ## [1] "Started InternetExplorerDriver server (64-bit)"                                           ## [2] "3.0.0.0"                                                                                  ## [3] "Listening on port 4567"                                                                   ## [4] "Log level is set to FATAL"                                                                ## [5] "Log file is set to C:\\Users\\john\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\RtmpqSdw94\\file5247395f2a.txt" ## [6] "Only local connections are allowed" ieDrv$stop() ## [1] TRUE

title: Basics
text: experience issues problems running one drivers/functions, please try running command terminal OS initially. can access command run using retcommand argument main package functions. continue problems, consider posting issue https://github.com/ropensci/wdman/issues

title: Authors and Citation
text: John Harrison. Author.            original author Ju Yeong Kim. Author.            rOpenSci maintainer Jonathan Völkle. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Harrison J, Kim J (2024). wdman: 'Webdriver'/'Selenium' Binary Manager. R package version 0.2.6, https://github.com/ropensci/wdman, https://docs.ropensci.org/wdman/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {wdman: 'Webdriver'/'Selenium' Binary Manager},   author = {John Harrison and Ju Yeong Kim},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.2.6, https://github.com/ropensci/wdman},   url = {https://docs.ropensci.org/wdman/}, }

title: Webdriver/Selenium Binary Manager
text: wdman (Webdriver Manager) R package allows user manage downloading/running third party binaries relating webdriver/selenium projects. package inspired similar node package webdriver-manager. checking/downloading binaries handled binman package, running binaries processes handled subprocess package. wdman package currently manages following binaries: Selenium standalone binary chromedriver PhantomJS binary geckodriver iedriver Associated five functions download/manage binaries: selenium(...) chrome(...) phantomjs(...) gecko(...) iedriver(...)

title: Webdriver/Selenium Binary Manager
text: can install wdman GitHub : package can also installed CRAN:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ropensci/wdman") install.packages("wdman")

title: Webdriver/Selenium Binary Manager
text: example, show one run Selenium standalone binary process:

title: Webdriver/Selenium Binary Manager
text: binary takes port argument defaults port = 4567L. number optional arguments use particular version binaries related browsers selenium may control. default, selenium function look use latest version . selenium function returns list functions handle representing running process. returned output, error log functions give access stdout/stderr pipes cumulative stdout/stderr messages respectively. stop function sends signal terminates process:
code: selServ <- selenium(verbose = FALSE) selServ$process  ## PROCESS 'file50e6163b37b8.sh', running, pid 21289. selServ$log()  ## $stderr ## [1] "13:25:51.744 INFO [GridLauncherV3.parse] - Selenium server version: 4.0.0-alpha-2, revision: f148142cf8"          ## [2] "13:25:52.174 INFO [GridLauncherV3.lambda$buildLaunchers$3] - Launching a standalone Selenium Server on port 4567" ## [3] "13:25:54.018 INFO [WebDriverServlet.<init>] - Initialising WebDriverServlet"                                      ## [4] "13:25:54.539 INFO [SeleniumServer.boot] - Selenium Server is up and running on port 4567"                          ## $stdout ## character(0) selServ$stop()  ## TRUE

title: Webdriver/Selenium Binary Manager
text: default, selenium function includes paths chromedriver/geckodriver/phantomjs Chrome/Firefox PhantomJS browsers available respectively. versions (chromever, geckover etc) given "latest". user passes value NULL driver, excluded. Windows operating systems, option included Internet Explorer driver also given. set iedrver = NULL ran default. Set iedrver = "latest" specific version string include Windows.

title: Webdriver/Selenium Binary Manager
text: details, please see package vignette.

title: Start chrome driver — chrome
text: Start chrome driver

title: Start chrome driver — chrome
code: chrome(   port = 4567L,   version = "latest",   path = "wd/hub",   check = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE,   retcommand = FALSE,   ... )

title: Start chrome driver — chrome
text: port Port run version version chromedriver run. Default = "latest" runs recent version. see version currently sourced run binman::list_versions("chromedriver") path base URL path prefix commands, e.g. wd/hub check TRUE check versions chromedriver available. new versions available downloaded. verbose TRUE, include status messages () retcommand TRUE return command passed process ... pass additional options driver

title: Start chrome driver — chrome
text: Returns list named elements process, output,  error, stop, log.  process object calling process.  output error functions reading latest     messages "stdout" "stderr" since last call whereas log function reads messages.     Lastly, stop call kill method  process kill process.

title: Start chrome driver — chrome
code: if (FALSE) { cDrv <- chrome() cDrv$output() cDrv$stop() }

title: Start gecko driver — gecko
text: Start gecko driver

title: Start gecko driver — gecko
code: gecko(   port = 4567L,   version = "latest",   check = TRUE,   loglevel = c("info", "fatal", "error", "warn", "config", "debug", "trace"),   verbose = TRUE,   retcommand = FALSE,   ... )

title: Start gecko driver — gecko
text: port Port run version version geckodriver run. Default = "latest" runs recent version. see version currently sourced run binman::list_versions("geckodriver") check TRUE check versions geckodriver available. new versions available downloaded. loglevel Set Gecko log level [values: fatal, error, warn, info, config, debug, trace] verbose TRUE, include status messages () retcommand TRUE return command passed process ... pass additional options driver

title: Start gecko driver — gecko
text: Returns list named elements process, output,  error, stop, log.  process object calling process.  output error functions reading latest     messages "stdout" "stderr" since last call whereas log function reads messages.     Lastly, stop call kill method  process kill process.

title: Start gecko driver — gecko
code: if (FALSE) { gDrv <- gecko() gDrv$output() gDrv$stop() }

title: Start IE driver server — iedriver
text: Start IE driver server

title: Start IE driver server — iedriver
code: iedriver(   port = 4567L,   version = "latest",   check = TRUE,   loglevel = c("FATAL", "TRACE", "DEBUG", "INFO", "WARN", "ERROR"),   verbose = TRUE,   retcommand = FALSE,   ... )

title: Start IE driver server — iedriver
text: port Port run version version IE driver server run. Default = "latest" runs recent version. see version currently sourced run binman::list_versions("iedriverserver") check TRUE check versions IE driver available. new versions available downloaded. loglevel Specifies log level used server. Valid values : TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL. Defaults FATAL specified. verbose TRUE, include status messages () retcommand TRUE return command passed process ... pass additional options driver

title: Start IE driver server — iedriver
text: Returns list named elements process, output,  error, stop, log.  process object calling process.  output error functions reading latest     messages "stdout" "stderr" since last call whereas log function reads messages.     Lastly, stop call kill method  process kill process.

title: Start IE driver server — iedriver
code: if (FALSE) { ieDrv <- iedriver() ieDrv$output() ieDrv$stop() }

title: Start phantomjs — phantomjs
text: Start phantomjs webdriver mode

title: Start phantomjs — phantomjs
code: phantomjs(   port = 4567L,   version = "2.1.1",   check = TRUE,   loglevel = c("INFO", "ERROR", "WARN", "DEBUG"),   verbose = TRUE,   retcommand = FALSE,   ... )

title: Start phantomjs — phantomjs
text: port Port run version version phantomjs run. Default = "2.2.1" runs recent stable version. see version currently sourced run binman::list_versions("phantomjs") check TRUE check versions phantomjs available. new versions available downloaded. loglevel Set phantomjs log level [values: fatal, error, warn, info, config, debug, trace] verbose TRUE, include status messages () retcommand TRUE return command passed process ... pass additional options driver

title: Start phantomjs — phantomjs
text: Returns list named elements process, output,  error, stop, log.  process object calling process.  output error functions reading latest     messages "stdout" "stderr" since last call whereas log function reads messages.     Lastly, stop call kill method  process kill process.

title: Start phantomjs — phantomjs
code: if (FALSE) { pjs <- phantomjs() pjs$output() pjs$stop() }

title: Start Selenium Server — selenium
text: Start Selenium Server

title: Start Selenium Server — selenium
code: selenium(   port = 4567L,   version = "latest",   chromever = "latest",   geckover = "latest",   iedrver = NULL,   phantomver = "2.1.1",   check = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE,   retcommand = FALSE,   ... )

title: Start Selenium Server — selenium
text: port Port run version version Selenium Server run. Default = "latest" runs recent version. see version currently sourced run binman::list_versions("seleniumserver") chromever version Chrome driver run. Default = "latest" runs recent version. see version currently sourced run binman::list_versions("chromedriver"), value NULL excludes adding chrome browser Selenium Server. geckover version Gecko driver run. Default = "latest" runs recent version. see version currently sourced run binman::list_versions("geckodriver"), value NULL excludes adding firefox browser Selenium Server. iedrver version IEDriverServer run. Default = "latest" runs recent version. see version currently sourced run binman::list_versions("iedriverserver"), value NULL excludes adding internet explorer browser Selenium Server. NOTE functionality Windows OS . phantomver version PhantomJS run. Default = "2.2.1" runs recent stable version. see version currently sourced run binman::list_versions("phantomjs"), value NULL excludes adding PhantomJS headless browser Selenium Server. check TRUE check versions selenium available versions associated drivers (chromever, geckover, phantomver, iedrver). new versions available downloaded. verbose TRUE, include status messages () retcommand TRUE return command passed process ... pass additional options driver

title: Start Selenium Server — selenium
text: Returns list named elements process, output,  error, stop, log.  process object calling process.  output error functions reading latest     messages "stdout" "stderr" since last call whereas log function reads messages.     Lastly, stop call kill method  process kill process.

title: Start Selenium Server — selenium
code: if (FALSE) { selServ <- selenium() selServ$output() selServ$stop() }

title: wdman — wdman
text: Webdriver/Selenium Binary Manager

title: wdman — wdman
text: number binary files associated Webdriver/Selenium project. package provides functions download binaries manage processes involving .

title: wdman 0.2.6
text: CRAN release: 2022-09-01 Fixing Mac install problem introduced new chromedriver binaries Mac M1 (#26)

title: wdman 0.2.5
text: CRAN release: 2020-01-31 Replaced subprocess (archived CRAN) processx.

title: wdman 0.2.4
text: CRAN release: 2018-07-21 Fixed tests CRAN re-submission.

title: wdman 0.2.3
text: Fixed issue checking JAVA (thanks Michal Libura #15)

title: wdman 0.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2017-01-23 Moved unix based systems write pipes file. Fixed issue shell escaping paths.

title: wdman 0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2017-01-20 Added read_pipes internal function windows drivers Fixed issue Windows blocking pipes. batch file now ran stdout/stderr piped file.

title: wdman 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-01-18 Added verbose arguments driver functions Import semver parsing semantic versions Added basic vignette operation. Set default PhantomJS version 2.1.1 (2.5.0-beta runs old ghostdriver currently). Added check argument driver functions. Added tests refactored code.

title: wdman 0.1.5
text: Use binman::sem_ver versioning. Remove v gecko versions. Improve logging selenium function.

title: wdman 0.1.4
text: Added tests driver functions.

title: wdman 0.1.3
text: Added selenium function. Added iedriver function.

title: wdman 0.1.2
text: Added phantomjs function.

title: wdman 0.1.1
text: Added chrome function. Added gecko function.

title: wdman 0.1.0
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
